**System**: Mac OS X 10.11
**Thrown From**: Atom Core

data.title: Tab Type "auto" overrides Soft Tabs setting.
data.body:
1. I should be able to make the tab button make tabs by disabling the Soft Tabs setting.
2. Tab Type "auto" should apply to "Auto Indent" when pressing enter after an indented line.

I think the only solution is to have a drop down for Soft Tabs, "Always", "Same as Tab Type" and "Never"

That would make Atom more usable with mixed language/mixed tab style files. Currently the best workaround is to Tab Type: "Hard" and Soft Tabs: "off" which will make Auto Indent create hard tabs on soft tabs documents.

data.title: `--wait` is not respected if atom is already open
data.body:
We use this command:
`git config --global core.editor "atom --wait"`
to use atom as the default git editor. 

But if another atom window is open, the `--wait` option is not respected and git just
closes with an empty commit message.

Even if we use `git config --global core.editor "atom --wait --new-window"`, it does not work.

This behaviour is on windows, on linux everything works just fine.

data.title: Add descriptions for config settings
data.body: This adds descriptions for core and editor config settings. I think this will help users understand the purpose of config settings and use them properly. I've definitely seen confusion about what some settings mean and I've been confused about some as well. Once this is merged, I'll start working on clarifying settings for individual packages. @atom/feedback I'd love your help in reviewing this and making these descriptions as clear and as helpful as possible. Please let me know if you have any wordsmithing advice. :pray: Before: After

data.title: markdown-preview plugin's problem
data.body: When using markdown-preview-plus plugin,I found it only support the `=======` or `-----------` to resolve the title syntax but can's support the `#` or `##` to resolve the title.

data.title: Matching Brackets
Mac fullscreen broken when switching resultions
data.body:
I see this problem when I plug-in my external monitors and the screen on which my atom is fullscreened changes (as well as the resolution). The area where atom is rendered is very small (smaller than the original resolution) and there is blank whitespace filling the remainder of the screen. See where the mouse is in the screenshot

![atom rendering broken](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/546081/10374860/33925bbc-6daa-11e5-8056-94a90b00955f.png)

data.title: Right click menu on two monitor setup is off position of actual mouse position
data.body:
Hi, when I right click anywhere in atom, menu shows on completely different position. It is quite far right and slightly below actual mouse cursor position. I am using Ubuntu 15.04 and have two monitors. One is laptop 1600x900 and other one is regular LCD 1280x1024

I can't capture screenshot because when i press it, menu disapers.

data.title: Atom hangs on Mac OS el capitan
data.body: Running Mac OS el capitan. Initial boot is very slow (i5 processor with 8GB RAM) and when i navigate to Settings-->Themes view the whole app crashes and the app prompts me to force quit. Restarting app/Force quitting not solving issue. P.S. I have installed latest version of atom + nuclide plugin.

data.title: The resource-path flag should figure prominently next to Atom's build instructions
data.body:
Hi,

I think it's quite a common use case that someone that follows the build instructions (e.g., [here](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/73728f501a9a7cde5b473e38f8e773a1c3efd847/docs/build-instructions/windows.md)) might want to try out development on Atom's source. 
In which case, it's not obvious how one can test out changes to the source apart from running `script/build`. This consumes way too much time, while the quick alternative of using the `--resource-path` flag is not obvious to a newcomer.

The usage of this flag should be documented clearly somewhere where a person going through the build instructions would see it. This can be added individually to the corresponding file for each OS, or described in some separate "hacking the Atom source" guide and linked to in said files.

Given some guidance towards which of these alternatives is preferable, I'm willing to write something up myself.

data.title: Retina & Non-retina redraw issue
data.body: When waking up my Mac (Retina) that is hooked up to a non-retina external display, the Atom editor only shows about 25% of itself with the rest of the app blank/white. What I normally have to do is drag the editor from my non-retina to the retina, which fixes the issue and then back over to the non-retina display.

data.title: Markdown syntax highlighting works in pre-formatted blocks but should not be applied
data.body:
When using 4-space indented blocks for pre-formatted text, styling syntax like `_` is interpreted directly, showing as italicized text in the editor. It also makes the formatting "leak" to the normal text, continuing into the next code block:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/582444/10365544/8a6d34e2-6dc4-11e5-9682-649780df581e.png)

Here, there should have been no formatting applied in the 4-space indented blocks, and the `Test` should have been non-italicized.

Atom version 1.0.19

data.title: Configuration option for text-rendering: optimizeLegibility
data.body: Implement a configuration option for `text-rendering: optimizeLegibility` as that is required for ligatures to work. See https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/3821#issuecomment-146474764

data.title: Uncaught TypeError when fold section button clicked in .coffee file
data.body:
I've seen a [issue](https://github.com/smashwilson/merge-conflicts/issues/98) which has similar stack trace, but this one can be different.
### Step to reproduce:
1. open a .coffee file
2. click one of the fold button (on the left of edit panel, right to line number, only visible when mouse hover). This may cause the bug.
3. if bug didn't appear, try another fold button.

The bug dosn't appear every time, event when I click the same button. 
If you click one fold button for many times repidly, the bug appears to.

**Atom Version**: 1.0.19
**System**: Ubuntu 14.04.3
**Thrown From**: Atom Core
### Stack Trace

Uncaught TypeError: Cannot read property 'onDidDestroy' of undefined

```

# Dev
No dev packages
```

data.title: Autosave to cache
data.body:
Like notepad++ does, load file once you open it, save hash somewhere to monitor file changes.
Once we start writing in the file we save to a cache somewhere, which means even after closing the editor (or just pulling the plug) we'll still have the files contents saved.

Then once we press save manually we overwrite the file we originally wrote.

Would be a nice feature i guess? :)

data.title: Atom and external screens
data.body:
I don't know how to describe this accurately, but I will give it a try.

**Background**
I use a laptop with a dock at work to use two extra screens. When connected to the dock I use Atom on an external screen and it works great.

**Problem**
The problem is when I close Atom and disconnect the laptop from my dock and later starts Atom again, it thinks that it's still on the external screen. Normally I just use `Windows`+`Left arrow` key to move the window to the laptop screen, but this do not work. Nothing happens.

The only think that do work is going to full screen mode. If I press `F11` then Atom shows up as expected on my laptop screen, but as soon as I exit full screen mode, Atom disappears to the (now non existent) external screen.

data.title: Bad cursor positioning when mixing RTL and LTR characters
data.body:
Using RTL characters only works just fine as of the latest Atom version:

![arabic](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/482957/10359927/1b30b5a8-6d9d-11e5-8b81-7c195c18c69e.gif)

However, as soon as we add LTR characters _before_ the RTL ones, Atom won't position the cursor _inside_ the RTL text. The following does in fact work just fine:

```
اثر کارآزمودگی test test
```

Whereas the snippet below does not:

```
test test اثر کارآزمودگی 
```

With the new character measurement mechanism we now degrade gracefully, but the cursor can only be placed before and after the arabic text. This _seems_ like a limitation in the `Range` API which gets confused when mixing the two: I think this kinda makes sense 'cause I believe that, in order to provide a full RTL editing experience, we should need to go beyond character measurement.

/cc: @nathansobo @izuzak

data.title: Toggle a modal panel won't work if use command palette
data.body:
To reproduce this bug:
1. Generate a new package with `package-generator:generate-package` named anything
2. use command palette to run `new-package-name:toggle`, the modal panel shows
3. use command palette to run the toggle command again, the same modal panel shows again
4. use `ctrl-alt-o`, the two modal panel hide.

Toggle a modal panel is working when using shortcut key, but not work when using command palette.

data.title: small bug for editing .cpp files
data.body:
When editing .cpp files
there is a small bug.

Atom editor doesn't act like.. it's supposed to

Try to type the following then you will recognize the problem right away.

std::cout << "hello world\n";

After \n
when you try to put the closing quotation
it doesn't close it.
It puts another opening quotation mark.
So.. it will be like the following:

std::cout << "hello world\n"";

I had to manually delete one of the quotation marks.

data.title: On Mac, binding anything to ctrl-/ produces a "whump" sound
data.body: I noticed it first in atomic-emacs triggering core:undo, but after some small experiments, it looks like the problem is in Atom.

data.title: style method calls (generated method names not wrapped in span)
data.body: Hi, I'm trying to style method calls in a syntax theme, but method names are not wrapped in any elements. ``` js Object.keys().filter(); ``` the line above gives me the following html (in dev tools): ``` html Object .keys ( ) .filter ( ) ; ``` but when I tried the atom/highlights package it gave me this (I thought atom uses that package), everything is wrapped in span, at least I can style it this way.: ``` html Object . keys ( ) ; ... ``` sorry if this wasn't the appropriate place to put this.

data.title: Bug in moving selected lines down
data.body:
There was a bug in moving lines down. 
The bug can be reproduced in the following steps:
- Make a text file with last line blank
- Select the entire row of third last line
- Try moving down. It won't move

![output](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/10784031/10346678/f98a38b0-6d4d-11e5-817b-91391134443b.gif)

data.title: Allow package install/removal from command pallet
data.body:
Hello, everyone

This is supposed to be marked as a feature idea.
 There is a feature in Sublime that simplifies plugin/package management very much and I often find myself trying to use on atom: to use the command pallete to remove packages.
In fact, in sublime you can also do the installation process via the pallete. The pallete is able to unfold into  "submenus/suboptions" to be acessed from there.
I'd like this also in atom, if it can be considered. I'm also considering developing a plugin for that, but as I'm so out of time these days I decided to share the idea here.
Thanks a bunch for the editor. Web tech FTW

data.title: Suddenly, Atom is dead
data.body:
As of today, when I open Atom, nothing really works.

https://drive.google.com/file/d/0By0MxtGl4s2YOW1ZaHBrck1JeFU/view?usp=drivesdk

That's all I get.  There's an option for Atom in the menu and that's it.  Eventually it  does this:

https://drive.google.com/file/d/0By0MxtGl4s2YTkJvd3ZMWTNfeGc/view?usp=drivesdk

I've uninstalled and deleted everything I could find in my AppData folders related to Atom.  Reinstalling does not fix the issue.

data.title: Allow a panesActiveItem show a saved Dialog
data.body:
Currently if you want to create a new file type eg:
- writes and reads over ssh
- writes and reads to a remote server
- writes and reads via ftp

This functionality can be elegantly achieved by:
-inheriting from File from pathwatcher and over-riding read/write methods and nativeEvent Listeners.
-making a few minor changes to an extended text-buffer.

The only way of providing saveAs functionality is by overriding the `activePane`. or shim `atom.showSaveDialogSync`, both are quite large changes to the atom for such a small requirement.
